data.name: FileSystem_Inconsistent
data.value: The file system on the LTO Flash! device may be in an inconsistent state.

data.name: FileSystem_InconsistentEnd
data.value:
File system operations that have been interrupted may have left the device in an unstable or unusable state.
To resolve this problem, click Send to LTO Flash to complete the update. If the problem persists, back up the contents of your LTO Flash!, reformat it, and try again.

data.name: FileSystem_InconsistentState
data.value: Unable to complete update! The file system may be in an inconsistent state.

data.name: Reformat_Message
data.value:
WARNING! Reformatting the LTO Flash! file system removes all content from the device! All ROMs, manuals, saved game state, and other content will be lost!
Are you certain you wish to proceed with this action?

data.name: FirmwareRestore_Message
data.value:
WARNING! Restoring the firmware to its factory default removes the most recent firmware from the device! This may result in different behavior or loss of features.
Are you certain you wish to proceed with this action?

data.name: UpdateFirmwareCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Update to a different version of LTO Flash! firmware.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Downgrade_MessageFormat
data.value:
Continuing with this operation will downgrade the firmware from version {0} to version {1}. This may result in loss of functionality or an unusable device.
Are you certain you wish to proceed with this action?

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_MessageFormat
data.value:
Continuing with this operation will upgrade the firmware from version {0} to version {1}.
Are you certain you wish to proceed with this action?

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_ShowReadmePrompt
data.value: Would you like to open the release notes?

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Prompt
data.value: Select a LTO Flash! Firmware Update

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Reapply_Message
data.value:
Continuing this operation will reapply version {0} of the firmware to the device.
Are you certain you wish to proceed with this action?

data.name: EcsCompatibilityMode_Disabled_ToolTipDescription
data.value: LTO Flash! will disable the ECS ROMs unless running a program that requires the ECS in order to function. Games that are only enhanced by the ECS (i.e. for which the ECS is optional) will not have ECS features enabled.

data.name: EcsCompatibilityMode_Enabled_ToolTipDescription
data.value: LTO Flash! will not attempt to disable the ECS ROMs in order to remedy any program incompatibilities. Some programs may not function correctly when the ECS is attached to the Master Component.

data.name: EcsCompatibilityMode_Limited_ToolTipDescription
data.value: LTO Flash! will only disable the ECS ROMs for programs that are known to be incompatible with the ECS. Games are presumed to be compatible with the ECS unless otherwise specified.

data.name: EcsCompatibilityMode_Strict_ToolTipDescription
data.value: LTO Flash! will enable the ECS ROMs only for programs known to require the ECS, or to offer enhanced features if the ECS is attached. (Factory Default)

data.name: IntellivisionIICompatibilityMode_Disabled_ToolTipDescription
data.value: LTO Flash! will not attempt to disable the lockout feature that is part of the Intellivision II Master Component's EXEC ROM. Certain programs will not work when run on an Intellivision II Master Component.

data.name: IntellivisionIICompatibilityMode_Full_ToolTipDescription
data.value: LTO Flash! will always attempt to disable the Intellivision II lockout feature. (Factory Default)

data.name: IntellivisionIICompatibilityMode_Limited_ToolTipDescription
data.value: LTO Flash! will attempt to disable the lockout feature only for programs known to be incompatible with the Intellivision II, which should allow them to run.

data.name: BackupCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Back up the contents of the LTO Flash!

data.name: DeviceMultistageCommand_BackupFileSystem_Failed
data.value: Failed to back up the file system.

data.name: CurrentFirmwareCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Currently active version of firmware running on the device.

data.name: FactoryFirmwareCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Version of firmware on the device as shipped. This will be the version of the firmware restored if you choose the Restore Firmware command.

data.name: SecondaryFirmwareCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Version of firmware on the device installed as an update. If an update is installed, the current version should be the same as this one.

data.name: BackupCommand_Failed_Message_Format
data.value:
A problem occurred when creating a backup of the file system. The error was:
{0}
This may occur if LTO Flash! is connected to your computer and a powered-on Intellivision simultaneously, or the device is unplugged from the system during the backup.
To avoid this problem, ensure the Master Component remains off for the duration of the backup operation. Also, do not unplug your LTO Flash! from the computer during the backup.
The backup may be incomplete. Would you like to keep it? If you choose 'No', it will be deleted.

data.name: DeviceCommand_InvalidFileSystemEntryCount_Format
data.value: Invalid response reading file system table. Data stream reported {0} entries but maximum possible is {1}.

data.name: DownloadAndPlayCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Play the program selected in the ROM list on the connected LTO Flash! Your LTO Flash! must be plugged into an Intellivision console with the power turned on, and not already running a program.

data.value: Replace the computer's menu layout with the menu layout on the active LTO Flash! device.

data.name: SyncHostToDeviceCommand_TipDescription

data.name: SyncClearPreviewChangesCommand_Tip
data.value: Clears the preview of changes that will be applied.

data.name: SyncHostToDevicePreviewCommand_Title
data.value: Comparing Host Menu Layout to LTO Flash! Menu Layout...

data.name: SyncHostToDeviceCommandCancelledNoChanges_Message
data.value: The file system update to send the menu layout to your LTO Flash! was cancelled before any changes were made.

data.name: SyncHostToDeviceCommandCancelled_Message
data.value:
The file system update to your LTO Flash! was cancelled. This may have resulted in files that are present, but not reachable in the menu from your Intellivision console.
To resume the update process, simply start again. The update will resume from the point at which it was interrupted. If you make further changes before resuming, those will also be included in the next udpate.
Would you also see which changes remain to be applied?

data.name: SyncHostToDeviceCommandComplete_Message
data.value: The contents of your LTO Flash! have been successfully updated.

data.name: SyncHostToDeviceCommandComplete_Title
data.value: Send Menu Layout to LTO FLash! Complete

data.name: FileSystem_InconsistencyError_NoFileSystem_Message
data.value: The file system appears to be in an inconsistent state. However, further analysis is not possible at this time.

data.name: DeviceCommand_InvalidFileSystemHeader_Format
data.value: File system table is invalid. Expected header of '{0}' but received a header of '{1}'.

data.name: SyncPreviewCommand_Failed_Message_Format
data.value:
A problem has occurred while generating the changes preview. The error was:
{0}

data.name: DeviceMultistageCommand_SyncingToFiles_Title
data.value: Getting Menu Layout from LTO Flash!...

data.name: DeviceMultistageCommand_UpdatingMenuLayout_ComputingChangesProgress
data.value: Reconciling device file system and local menu layout...

data.name: DeviceMultistageCommand_UpdatingMenuLayout_InconsistentState
data.value: The file system on the device is in an inconsistent state.

data.name: DeviceMultistageCommand_UpdatingMenuLayout_InconsistentStateErrorMessage
data.value:
The file system on the connected device is not in a consistent state. It appears that an update to it was interrupted while in progress. The resulting menu may be incomplete or inaccurate.
The recommended course of action in this case is to send a valid menu layout to your device, rather than force your menu layout to match that of your LTO Flash!
Remember that you can also perform a backup of your LTO Flash! if you so desire, which will preserve its contents, even if it is in an inconsistent state.
If you proceed with using the LTO Flash! to define the menu layout, unreachable items will be ignored.
Do you wish to proceed with this update, even though the contents are in an inconsistent state?

data.name: FileSystem_InvalidFileType
data.value: Unexpected file type encountered in file system.

data.name: FileSystem_OutOfForksError
data.value: The file system cannot accommodate all of the ROMs, manuals, and save data files. To preserve save game information, you will need to reduce the number of ROMs and / or manuals you have specified in your menu layout.

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommandCancelled_Message
data.value: The menu layout update from your LTO Flash! was cancelled. This should not have modified the contents of your menu layout.

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommandCancelled_Title
data.value: Get Menu Layout from LTO Flash! Cancelled

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommandComplete_Message
data.value: The contents of your menu layout have been updated to match the contents of your LTO Flash!

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommandComplete_Title
data.value: Get Menu Layout from LTO Flash! Complete

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommand_Failed_Message_Format
data.value:
A problem has occurred during the menu layout update. The error was:
{0}
This may occur for several reasons: - You disconnected LTO Flash! from the computer during the update - LTO Flash! was also inserted into an Intellivision console, the console's power was turned on during the update
To help ensure a consistent update: - Turn off your Intellivision console, if applicable - Disconnect and reconnect your LTO Flash! within this application

Items will be added to the top-level folder in the menu layout. Folders containing ROMs will be reflected as folders in the menu layout as well.

data.name: SetBackgroundGarbageCollectCommand_TipDescription
data.value: When enabled, your LTO Flash! will perform file system maintenance and cleanup in the background while you navigate the menus. (Factory Default: ON)

data.name: SetKeyclicksCommand_TipDescription
data.value: When enabled, the 'key click' sound effect is active when navigating menus on the console. (Factory Default: OFF)

data.name: SetSaveMenuPositionCommand_TipDescription
data.value: When enabled, your LTO Flash! will resume at the last selected menu selection.

data.name: ShowTitleScreen_Always_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Always show the title screen whenever the system is powered on or reset to the menu. (Factory Default)

data.name: ShowTitleScreen_Never_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Never show the title screen - immediately show the menu.

data.name: ShowTitleScreen_OnPowerUp_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Only show the title screen the system is initially powered up.

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommand_TipTitle
data.value: Get Menu Layout from LTO Flash!

data.name: GoToFTDIDriverPageCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Visit the driver download page for FTDI Virtual COM Port (VCP) drivers.

data.name: FtdiDriverVersionCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Displays the version of the FTDI Virtual COM Port driver last used to communicate with LTO Flash!

data.name: LaunchFtdiDriverInstallerCommand_NoDriverPromptMessageFormat
data.value:
The LTO Flash! User Interface is unable to locate the FTDI Virtual COM Port driver on your system. This driver is necessary to communicate with your LTO Flash!
A copy of the driver installer has been included with the LTO Flash! User Interface, though it may not be the most recent release. To get the most recent driver, you can visit the FTDI driver download page by choosing the following menu option:
{0}
Would you like to launch the FTDI Virtual COM Port driver installer included with LTO Flash! User Interface?

data.name: LaunchFtdiDriverInstallerCommand_PromptMessage
data.value:
If you choose to proceed, the installer for the FTDI Virtual COM Port driver will be launched with elevated permissions. This driver is necessary to communicate with your LTO Flash!
On most systems, this driver will automatically be installed the first time you connect your LTO Flash! to the computer. On Mac OS X and in some Windows 10 installations, this may not occur. If the LTO Flash! User Interface cannot detect your device, it's possible that direct installation of the driver is necessary.
Would you like to launch the FTDI Virtual COM Port driver installer?

data.name: LaunchFtdiDriverInstallerCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Launch the FTDI driver installer included with LTO Flash!. Note that this may not be the most recent version. Visit the FTDI website for the most current driver version.

data.name: FtdiDriverIdentification_ErrorMessage
data.value: An exception execucting driver information query.

data.name: FtdiDriverIdentification_Error_Title
data.value: Failed to Enumerate FTDI Driver Information

data.name: SaveMenuPosition_Always_ToolTipDescription
data.value: The last selected menu location is always saved. After a reset or power up, LTO Flash! will resume at the location in the menu you were last visiting.

data.name: SaveMenuPosition_Never_ToolTipDescription
data.value: The last selected menu location is never saved. After reset or power up, LTO Flash! will always start at the root menu.

data.name: SaveMenuPosition_SessionOnly_ToolTipDescription
data.value: The last selected menu location will be saved when you reset your Intellivision. When you turn off the power to your console, the next time you use your LTO Flash! will start at the root menu. (Factory Default)

data.name: BackupMenuLayoutCommand_Message
data.value: Backup copies of your Menu Layout and ROM list have been stored in the following location:

data.name: BackupMenuLayoutCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Make a backup copy of the current menu layout.

data.name: EmptyMenuLayoutCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Removes all entries from the Menu Layout.

data.name: EmptyMenuLayoutCommand_WarningMessage
data.value:
WARNING!
Choosing to empty your Menu Layout will remove all entries from your menu!
This will NOT affect the menu on your LTO Flash!.
Are you sure you wish to proceed?

data.name: RestoreMenuLayoutCommand_MissingFilesErrorMessage
data.value: The following required backup files could not be found in the backup directory:

data.name: RestoreMenuLayoutCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Replaces the current Menu Layout and ROM list with versions from a backup copy.

data.name: RestoreMenuLayoutCommand_WarningMessage
data.value:
WARNING!
Restoring a Menu Layout from a backup will replace your current Menu Layout and ROM list! If you have moved or deleted ROMs since creating the backup, you may encounter errors.
This will NOT affect the menu on your LTO Flash!.
Would you like to continue with the restore operation?

data.name: UpdateFirmwareCommand_ValidationFailedFormat
OpenDeviceBackupsDirectoryCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Opens the folder containing backups made for the currently connected LTO Flash! device.

data.name: OpenMenuLayoutBackupsDirectoryCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Opens the folder containing Menu Layout and ROM list backups.

data.name: OpenErrorLogsDirectoryCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Opens the file system folder containing error logs.

data.name: SyncErrors_DirtyFileSystemMessage
data.value: File system was already in an inconsistent state

data.name: BackupCommandComplete_DireWarning
data.value:
As much data has been retrieved as possible, but some files may not be accessible. A complete list of these items has been recorded in an error report in the backup directory.
You should not use this backup as a restore point.
Would you like to keep this backup?

data.name: BackupCommandComplete_EncounteredErrors
data.value: The following problems were discovered during backup:

data.name: SyncErrors_OrphanedForksFormat
data.value: A total of {0} unreachable data forks were discovered

data.name: SyncErrors_UnsupportedForksFormat
data.value: A total of {0} unsupported data forks were discovered

data.name: SyncErrors_UnsupportedForksInfo
data.value: You may wish to check for an updated version the LTO Flash! User Interface software if you continue to encounter this error.

data.name: UnsupportedForkKindException_MessageFormat
data.value: An unsupported fork of type '{0}' has been encountered.

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommandComplete_DireWarning
data.value: As much data has been retrieved as possible, but not all items on the device will be reachable. A complete list of these items has been recorded in an error report in the ErrorLogs directory.

data.name: SyncDeviceToHostCommandComplete_WarningsMessage
data.value: The contents of your menu layout have been updated. However, during the process, some inconsistencies were encountered:

data.name: SyncErrors_MissingEntriesFormat
data.value: Unable to create entries for {0} items

data.name: SyncErrors_UnableToRetrieveForksFormat
data.value: Unable to retrieve {0} forks from device

data.name: MenuLayout_MissingItem_Tip
data.value: This item is missing; cached data may be used if available

data.name: RomToLuigiFailed_InvalidOutputFileFormat
data.value: Unable to prepare ROM for deployment. The path '{0}' either does not exist, or is otherwise invalid.

data.name: ValidateDataBlock_BadAddressAlignmentFormat
data.value: The memory address: 0x{0:X8} is not properly word aligned.

data.name: ValidateDataBlock_BadAddressFormat
data.value: The memory address: 0x{0:X8} for the data block in LTO Flash! RAM is invalid.

data.name: ValidateDataBlock_BadSizeOrAddressFormat
data.value: Data block of size {0} cannot be placed into LTO Flash! RAM at address: 0x{1:X8}.

data.name: ValidateDataBlock_BlockTooLargeFormat
data.value: Data block size of {0} is too large to fit into LTO Flash! RAM.

data.name: ValidateDataBlock_ZeroBlockSize
data.value: Data block size cannot be zero!

data.name: SyncHostToDeviceCommand_Failed_Resolution
data.value:
This problem may occur for several reasons: - You disconnected LTO Flash! from your computer during the update - LTO Flash! was also inserted into an Intellivision console, the console's power was turned on during the update - Files necessary for the update could not be found - An error occurred when preparing the file for deployment
To ensure a consistent update: - Turn off your console, if applicable - Disconnect and reconnect your LTO Flash! within this application - Ensure that all ROMs both in the ROM list and the Menu Layout are available - Remove and re-add ROMs that report a problem

data.name: SyncHostToDeviceCommand_GatherUpdatesFailedMessage
data.value: Failed to gather data needed to update file system.

data.name: SyncHostToDevice_FetchUpdateOperationFailedMessage
data.value: Failed to retrieve update operation data.

data.name: SyncPreviewCommand_Failed_Resolution
data.value:
This may occur if you disconnected LTO Flash! from your computer during the process or, if your LTO Flash! was also inserted into an Intellivision console, the console's power was turned on during the operation.
To prevent this error, turn off your console, if applicable, and try again. If the problem persists, also disconnect your LTO Flash! from your computer and reconnect it.

data.name: AddItemRejected_TooManyFolders_Format
